snippet: A former executive of Texas’ $3 billion cancer-fighting effort was indicted over an improperly awarded $11 million taxpayer-funded grant that plunged the state agency into turmoil.
abstract: Jerald Cobbs, former executive of Cancer Prevention and Research Institute of Texas, state's $3 billion cancer-fighting effort, is indicted over an improperly awarded $11 million taxpayer-funded grant that plunged agency into turmoil.
lead_paragraph: A former executive of Texas’ $3 billion cancer-fighting effort was indicted over an improperly awarded $11 million taxpayer-funded grant that plunged the state agency into turmoil.

headline.main: Texas: Inquiry Into Cancer Agency Ends With One Indictment
headline.print_headline: Texas: Inquiry Into Cancer Agency Ends With One Indictment

keywords.value: Cancer Prevention and Research Institute of Texas
